all_text_timv: Sacred harp singing [sound recording]. Cambridge, MA : Rounder, [1998] ℗1998 1 audio disc : digital ; 4 3/4 in. performed music prm rdacontent audio s rdamedia audio disc sd rdacarrier The Library of Congress Archive of Folk Culture Compact disc. Historical and descriptive notes by Wayne D. Shirley, with song texts (25 p. : ill., music) inserted in container. Originally issued in 1943 by the Archive of American Folk Song. Windham (2:13) -- Mear (2:09) -- Wondrous love (2:16) -- Lover of the Lord (1:35) -- Lover of the Lord (version 2) (1:32) -- Montgomery (2:08) -- Northfield (1:08) -- Mount Zion (2:21) -- Milford (1:30) -- Stratfield (1:53) -- Evening shade (1:50) -- Ballstown (1:40) -- Edom (2:03) -- Fillmore (2:03) -- Sardis (2:08) -- Mission (2:14) -- Vain world adieu (2:00) -- Heavenly vision (3:02) -- David's lamentation (1:51) -- Sherburne (2:01). Recorded by Alan Lomax and George Pullen Jackson in 1942, at the Alabama Sacred Harp Singing Convention. Hymns, English. Choruses, Sacred (Mixed voices), Unaccompanied. Shape-note singing Southern States. Church music Southern States. Folk music United States. Folk songs, English Southern States. Jackson, George Pullen, 1874-1953. Lomax, Alan, 1915-2002. Archive of Folk Culture (U.S.) Library of Congress Archive of Folk Culture.
